mil3.7.14:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, is it possible to cut through the subtlest of all things?”
mil3.7.14:1.3: “Yes, your majesty, it is possible to cut through the subtlest of all things.”
mil3.7.14:1.4: “Then what, venerable sir, is the subtlest of all things?”
mil3.7.14:1.5: “The Dhamma, your majesty, is the subtlest of all things. But not all qualities are subtle, your majesty, subtle or coarse is a designation for a quality.
mil3.7.14:1.6: Whatever is to be cut through, all that is cut through by wisdom. There is nothing else other than wisdom for cutting through.”
